response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and line two 8-inch round cake pans. Sift together 2 cups flour, 1¾ cups sugar, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 1½ tsp baking soda, 1½ tsp baking powder, and 1 tsp salt into a large bowl.",
  "step2": "Add 2 eggs, 1 cup milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 tsp vanilla to the dry ingredients. Mix on medium speed until combined. Gradually add 1 cup boiling water, mixing until the batter is smooth (it will be thin).",
  "step3": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool in pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto wire racks.",
  "step4": "For the frosting, beat 1 cup softened butter until creamy. Gradually add 3½ cups powdered sugar and ½ cup cocoa powder, mixing well. Add ½ cup milk and 2 tsp vanilla, then beat until light and fluffy.",
  "step5": "Once cakes are completely cool, level the tops if needed. Spread a layer of frosting on one cake, place the second on top. Frost the top and sides with the remaining frosting, smoothing with a spatula.",
  "step6": "Decorate with chocolate shavings or sprinkles if desired. Let set for 30 minutes before slicing. Serve at room temperature. Store covered at room temperature for up to 3 days. Enjoy your delicious chocolate cake!"
}
